meals.name: Pepper Steak Stir Fry
method: Ingredients: 1 tbsp vegetable oil. 1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, 1.25 lbs steak thinly sliced, 2 tsp minced garlic, 0.25 cup soy sauce, 1.5 tbsp sugar, 1.5 tbsp cornstarch.
Cook the rice and keep warm.
Heat 1 tsp vegetable oil over medium high heat.
Add peppers and cook for 3-4 mins or until just tender. Remove the peppers from the pan.
Add remaining oil to the pan. Season the steak with salt and pepper to taste.
Increase heat to high. Add steak to the pan and cook for 5-6 mins until lightly brown.
Add the garlic and ginger, then cook for 30secs.
Place the peppers back in the pan with the steak.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sugar, 0.25 cup water and cornstarch.
Pour the sauce over the steak and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2-3 mins until sauce just thickens.

meals.name: Garlic Beef and Broccoli Noodles
method: Ingredients: 3 cups broccoli florets, 1 tbsp olive oil, 8 oz sliced steak, 3 tsp minced garlic, 8 oz sliced mushrooms, 0.25 cup packed brown sugar, 0.5 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp hoisin sauce, 2 tsp sesame oil, 0.25 tsp ground ginger, 0.25 tsp chili flakes, 0.25 tsp pepper, 1 tbsp cornstarch.
Cook noodles per packet  instructions. Add 3 cups of broccoli in the last 5 mins of cooking.
Drain the noodles and broccoli.
While noodles are cookingm add 1 tbsp olive oil to pan.
Cook steak until no longer pink.
Add 3 tsp minced garlic and 8 oz mushrooms and cook a minute more.
Whisk together 0.25 cup packed brown sugar, 0.5 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp hoisin sauce, 2 tsp sesame oil, 0.25 tsp ground ginger, 0.25 tsp pepper flakes, 0.25 tsp pepper and 1 tbsp cornstarch.
Add noodles to the pan, pour the sauce on top, mix until incorporated and cook for 2-3 mins until heated through.

meals.name: Thai Green Curry
method: Ingredients: 3 tbsp Thai Green Curry Paste (homemade or store bought). 400ml can coconut milk, 1 tbsp plain flour (optional), 500g chicken breast chopped into bitesize cubes, Juice and zest of half a lime, 2 tsp soft brown sugar, few splashes of fish sauce.
Add 3 tbsp Thai green curry paste to a pan on medium heat and cook for 1 min to release the flavours.
Add a can of coconut milk and stir well until fully combined with the paste.
Continue to stir until heated through.
Next add a small amount of cold water to 1 tbsp of plain flour and mix into a paste. Add this to the sauce and stir in.(optional for gluten free)
Add the raw, cubed chicken to the thai sauce and bring to a gentle simmer. TIP: Do not boil as this will cause the sauce to thin out.
Season with lime juice, lime zest, brown sugar and fish sauce. Stir well and cook at simmer for 2-3 mins or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
method: Ingredients: 3 tbsps oil, 1 medium onion, 1 red bell pepper, 2 tbsps minced ginger, 6 cloves garlic, 2 tsp ground tumeric, 2 tsp ground coriander, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp cayenne pepper, 0.25 cup tomato paste, 2 cups tomato sauce, 1 cup water, 1 cup cooking cream.
Heat the oil in a large pan to medium heat. Add the onion and peppers. Cook for 5 mins to soften.
Add the ginger, garlic, cumin, turmeric, coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper, and garam masala. Stir and cook for 30secs to bloom the spices.
Stir in toato paste, tomato sauce and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for at least 10 mins, longer if you'd like to develop more flavour.
Add the cooking cream and stir to mix through

meals.name: Szechuan Beef
method: Igredients: 0.25 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp cornstarch (optional), 1 tbsp sriracha sauce, 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar, 0.5 tsp Chinese Five Spice, 0.5 chili flakes, 0.5 tsp garlic powder, 0.5 tsp ground ginger.
Whisk all ingredients together until combined.
Thinly slice the steak and marinate in sauce for at least 30mins.
Add steak and sauce mixture to a pan on medium high heat and cook for 6-7 mins.
Serve over rice.

meals.name: Savoury Mince and Mash
method: Ingredients: 2 tbsps vegetable oil, 1 medium onion (finely diced), 2 garlic cloves (minced), 500g beef mince, 2 carrots (finely diced), 1 celery stick (finely diced), 2 tbsp tomato paste, 1 tbsp plain flour, 400ml beef stock, good splash of Worcestershire sauce, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp mixed herbs, 100g frozen peas, mashed potatoes.
Boil potatoes and mash with butter to taste.
Heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 8 mins before adding the garlic and cooking for another 2 mins.
Turn heat up to high and add the beef mince. Cook for 8-10 mins, breaking it up with a spoon and allowing it to get some colour before stirring to brown all over.

Add the carrots and celery and cook for 2 mins. Add the tomate paste and flour and cook for another 2 mins, then stir in the beef stock, Worcestershite sauce, bay leaves and dried mixed herbs and season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 mins. ADd the peas and cook for a final 5 mins, adding a dash of water if it looks too dry.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

meals.name: Creamy Chicken and Bacon Pasta
method: Ingredients: 180g pasta, 150-200g bacon (chopped), 180g chicken breast (cut in half horizontally), 1 tbsp butter, 2 garlic cloves (minced), 0.5 onion (finely chopped)< 0.75 cup cooking cream, 0.75 cup pasta cooking water (reserved), 0.5 cup fresh grated parmesan.
Cook spaghetti MINUS 2 mins (will finish cooking in sauce); reserve 0.75 cup pasta water.
Fry bacon until golden, drain on paper towel.
Season chicken on both sides, and cook in bacon fat, 2 mins per side.
OPTIONAL: Wipe pan to keep sauce ptty and for a buttery clean tasate rather than very bacony.
Over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic and onion. Cook for 3-4 mins until onion is light golden and soft.
Add cooking cream, 0.75 cup pasta water and parmesan. Stir, then simmer for 2 mins until it reduces slightly.
Add cooked pasta and toss gently in the sauce until covered.
Toss through bacon and chicken.

meals.name: Honey Pepper Pork Stir Fry
method: Ingredients: 500g pork tenderloin (cut into thin strips), 3 tsp cornstarch, 0.25 cup soy sauce, 0.25 cup honey, 1 tbsp fresh grated ginger, 1 large garlic clove, 2 tsp fresh ground black pepper, 1 large head broccoli (cut into small florets), 1 red bell pepper, 2 tbsp olive oil, 0.25 cup water.
In a bowl, mix the pork strips and constarch well. Add soy sauce, honey, ginger and garlic and mix. Allow to arinate for at least 15 mins or up to 1 hour.
Heat 1 tsp oil over medium high heat.
Add half the pork (allowing some of the marinade to drip off before adding it to the pan).
Cook, stirring regularly, until the juice has almost all evaporated and it starts to caramelise (4-5 mins)
Transfer to a clean plate. Repeat with remaining pork.
Wipe the pan out with paper towel (to remove any burnt bits) then add the last tsp oil over medium heat.
Add the red bell pepper and broccoli. Cook, stirring often, until tender (4-5 mins).
Add the pork back to the pan and stir to combine.
Mix together 0.25 cup water and remaining marinade, then pour it into the pan. Mix everything well and cook for a futher minute or so.
Stir in the ground black pepper to taste.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Sun Dried Tomato and Chicken Pasta
method: Ingredients: 3 garlic cloves (minced), 4 oz sun-dried tomatoes, 2 tsp olive oil (from sun-dried tomatoes), 1 lb chicken fillets (sliced), 0.25 tsp salt, 0.25 tsp paprika, 1 cup cooking cream, 1 cup mozzarella cheese (shredded), 8 oz penne pasta, 0.5 cup reserved pasta water.
In a pan, saute garlic and sun-dried tomatoes (drained) in 2 tbsp olive oil for 1 min until the garlic is fragrant.
Remove the sun-dried tomatoes from the skillet, leaving the olive oil.
Add sliced chicken (salted and lightly coated in paprika for colour) and cook on high heat for 1 min on each side. Remove from heat.
Cook pasta acording to package instructions. Reserve some pasta water. Drain the pasta.
SLice sun-dried tomatoes into smaller pieces and add the back to the pan with the chicken.
To make creamy pasta sauce, add cooking cream and mozzarella to the pan and bring to a gentle boil.
Immediately reduce and simmer to cook, stirring constantly, until all cheese melts and creamy sauce forms.
Add cooked and drained pasta to the pan with the cream sauce and stir to combine.
If creamy sauce is too thick, add about 0.5 cup of the reserved pasta water to thin it out. Add a little at a time to manage consistency.

meals.name: Honey Garlic Chicken
method: Ingredients: 5 Chicken Fillets, 0.5 cup plain flour, 0.5 tsp salt, 0.5 tsp ground black pepper, 2 cups vegetable oil, 1 tbsp butter, 4 cloves garlic (minced), 1/3 cup honey, 1/3 cup chicken stock, 1 tbsp rive wine vinegar, 1 tbsp soy sauce.
Cook rice and keep warm.
Slice chicken fillets into bitesize chunks. Add to bowl and season with salt and pepper. Toss chicken in flour until coated.
Heat enough oil to be able to deep fry chicken pieces in batches until golden brown on all sides. Remove from pan and drain on paper towel.
While chicken is frying, melt butter in a small saucepan and add minced garlic. Cook for 1-2 mins until fragrant.

Mix together 1/3 cup chicken stock, 1/3 cup honey, 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar together and pour into garlic and butter. stir together and heat until bubbling over high heat, then reduced to thicken.
Once all chicken is cooked, remove oil from pan, wipe with paper towel to remove burnt bits, then add chicken and sauce mix into the pan.
Toss over low heat for 2-3 mins to coat the chicken.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken
method: Ingredients: 5 chicken fillets (cut into strips), 2 tbsp olive oil (reserved from sun-dried tomatoes), 0.5 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 small red onion, 3 cloves garlic, 0.5 cup sun-dried tomatoes (drained and chopped), 2 red peppers (cut into strips), 0.5 cup cooking cream, 0.5 cup chicken stock, 3 tbsp basil pesto.
Heat 1 tbsp reserved olive oil over medium high heat.
Season chicken strips with Italian seasoning, salt and pepper and add them to the pan. Cook for 7-8 mins or until cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside.
Combine cooking cream, chicken stock and pesto and whisk together until well combined an set aside.
Add remaining oil to the pan. Stir in the onions and cook for 2 mins. Stir in garlic and sun-dried tomatoes, cook for 30secs until fragrant.
Add red bell pepper strips and continue cooking for 4 mins until fork tender.
Add the prepared pesto sauce to the pan and bring to a simmer.
Return the chicken to the pan andcook for 2 mins until heated through and the sauce is a little thickened.
Serve with pasta.

meals.name: Chicken Korma
method: Ingredients: 5 chicken fillets (bitesize chunks). SAUCE: 0.5 cup cashews (blitzed), 3 tbsp tomato paste, 4 garlic cloves, 1 tbsp fresh ginger (minced), 1 tbsp garam masala, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp ground coriander, 0.5 tsp ground cardamom, 0.5 tsp cumin, 0.5 tsp cinnamon, 1 cup plain Greek Yoghurt.KORMA: 1 tbsp olive oil, 2-3 spicy peppers, 1 medium onion, 0.5 cup chicken stock, 1 can coconut milk.
Cook rice and keep warm.

Add cashew nuts to a food processor and pulse to break them up (more depending if you want to have chunks of cashew or a smooth texture). Add tomato paste, garlic, ginger, and seasonings. Add salt and pepper to taste and pulse together to form a thick paste. If too thick, add water gradually until required consistency is achieved.
Add Greek yoghurt and pulse together to make the marinade.
Spoon marinade over chopped chicken and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight to let the flavours develop.
Heat oil in pan, add peppers and onion an cook for 5 mins to soften.
Add the chicken with all of the marinade along with the chicken stock. Stir to combine and cook for 15 mins, stirring occasionally.
Stir in coconut milk and simmer for at least 10 mins, more to allow flavour to develop more.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Creamy Garlic Parmesan Chicken
method: Ingredients: 2 chicken fillets, 0.5 tsp garlic powder, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp butter, 1 tbsp flour, 3 garlic cloves, 0.5 cup chicken stock, 1 cup cooking cream, 0.5 cup freshly grated parmesan, 1 tbsp parsley.
Cut the chicken in half lengthways to make 4 pieces. Season generously on both sides with salt, pepper and garlic powder.
Add olive oil and butter to pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken for 5-6 mins per side or until its nicely seared and cooked through. Transfer chicken to plate and cover with tin foil to keep warm.
In the medium high heat pan, sprinkle in the flour and garlic, cooking for about 1 min, stirring often.
Pour in chicken stock and whisk until the flour has dissolved and the liquid is reduced by half.
Stir in cooking cream and let it bubble gently for a few mins until sauce is thickened.
Remove from heat and stir in grated parmesan until melted.
Add chicken fillets back to pan and spoon over sauce.
Serve with pasta.

meals.name: Chicken Fajitas
method: Ingredients: 1 tbsp hot chili powder, 0.5 tbsp salt, 0.5 tbsp cumin, 0.5 tbsp oregano, 0.5 tbsp smoked paprika, 0.75 tsp onion powder, 0.75 tsp garlic powder, 0.75 tsp cayenne pepper, 0.75 tsp fresh ground black pepper.
Mix all spices together until combined. Mix through with just enough olive oil to create a marinade (approx 0.5 cup).
Add whole chicken fillets and coat.
Heat oven to 180°C and cook for 30 mins or until cooked through.
Fill wraps with chicken (add your preferred toppings).
Serve immediately.

meals.name: Cajun or Plain Steak and Cheese Pockets
method: Ingredients: 2.5 tsp smoked paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp fresh ground black pepper, 1 tsp cayenne pepper, 1.25 tsp oregano, 1.25 tsp dried thyme, 0.5 tsp chili flakes.
Mix the spice blend (or keep plain if preferred).
Slice steak thinly and toss with spices and a little oil.
Sear steak quickly in a hot pan.
Fill pockets/wraps with steak (and cheese if using).
Toast/bake until hot and melty.

meals.name: Sweet Ginger Chili Chicken
method: Ingredients: 2 chicken fillets (bitesize chunks), 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 3 garlic cloves (minced), 1 tbsp fresh ginger (minced), 0.25 cup soy sauce, 0.25 cup sweet chili sauce, 2 tbsp honey, 1 tsp sesame oil, chili flakes (to taste).
In a bowl, combine soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, honey, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, minced garlic and minced ginger. Mix well.
Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
Cook rice and keep warm.
Heat the vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 4-5 mins per side.

Reduce heat to medium and pour the sauce mixture over the chicken. Stir to coat the chicken evenly with the sauce. Allow to simmer for 2-3 mins until the sauce thickens slightly. Add some chicken stock or water if the sauce is too thick.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Hoisin Ginger Chicken
method: Ingredients: MARINADE: 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar, 1 tbsp brown sugar.
STIR FRY: 5 chicken fillets (bitesize chunks), vegetable oil, 0.5 onion (chopped), 1 red bell pepper, 2 tsp fresh grated ginger, 4 garlic cloves (minced).
BREADING: 1 cup flour, 2 tbsp cornstarch, 0.5 tsp salt, 0.25 tsp ground ginger, 0.25 tsp garlic powder, 0.25 tsp cumin, 0.25 tsp ground black pepper, 2 eggs.

HIOSIN GINGER SAUCE: 3 tbsp hoisin sauce, 3 tbsp sweet chili sauce, 3 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp water, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 0.5 tsp sriracha, 1 tsp cornstarch.
Mix together the marinade ingredients in a ziplock bag. Add chicken and mix to coat completely. Marinate for at least 30 mins at room temp or up to 6 hours refrigerated.
Mix together all of the Hoisin Ginger Sauce ingredients and set aside.
Mix together the breadin ingredients except for the eggs.
When ready to cook, drain excess marinade from chicken without removing chicken from bag. Add eggs to bag and toss chicken until evenly coated.
Remove coated chicken from back and coat in breading mix.
Heat enough vegetable oil to deep fry the chicken pieces. Cook in batches.
Wipe out pan. Heat 1 tbsp oil over medium high heat. Add onions and saute for 2 mins. Add red bell peppers, grated ginger and minced garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Stir sauce to combine again and add to pan. Simmer until sauce is warmed through and thickened. ADd chicken and toss to coat.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Ginger Garlic Pork
method: Ingredients: 0.5 cup soy sauce, 0.5 cup hoisin sauce, 5 garlic cloves (minced), 2 tbsp fresh grated ginger, 1 tbsp lemongrass paste (optional), 2 tbsp sriracha, 5 pork chops (thin strips), 2 tbsp sesame oil, 2 large carrots (sliced), 8 oz mushrooms (sliced), 1 red bell pepper (sliced), 1 onion (sliced).
In a bowl, combine soy sauce, hoisin sauce, garlic, ginger, lemongrass paste and sriracha.
Whisk until evenly mixed together.
Put the pork slices in a bowl. Pour 0.25 cup of the garlic ginger sauce over the pork and mix to coat evenly.
Marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight in the fridge. Place remaining garlic ginger sauce in fridge as well if overnight.
In a pan over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of the sesame oil and the pork. Cook for 5 mins, stirring occasionally. Remove pork from skillet and set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 tbsp sesame oil and carrots, mushrooms, peppers and onions. Cook for 5-8 mins, stirring occasionally.
Add pork and remaining garlic ginger sauce to the pan. Cook for an additional 3-4 mins.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Chicken Carbonara
method: Ingredients: Penne pasta, 1 tbsp olive oil, 2 chicken breasts (strips), 1 tbsp smoked paprika, 2 tbsp cornstarch, 1 cup peas, 3 garlic cloves (minced), 1 cup chicken stock, 0.75 grated parmesan.
Cook penne in salted water, reserve 0.5 cup pasta water, then drain remaining water. Whisk the reserved pasta water with the cornstarch until no lumps. Set aside until ready to use.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium heat.
Add the sliced chicken and sprinkle with 1 tbsp smoked paprika, salt and pepper (to taste). Cook until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the 1 cup peas and minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute or until the garlic releases its flavour.
Pour the pasta water/cornstarch mix, 1 cup milk and 1 cup chicken stock into pan and stir well to combine. The sauce should start to thicken almost immediately.
Once the sauce is thick and coats the back of the spoon, stir in the cooked pasta.
Sprinkle the pasta with 0.785 cup grated parmesan and 2 tbsp chopped parsley and serve immediately.

meals.name: Creamy Garlic Chicken and Mash
method: Ingredients: 2 chicken fillets, 3 tsp Italian Seasoning, 1/3 cup flour, 4 tbsp Parmesan (grated), 3 tbsp olive oil, 2.5 cup chicken stock, 1 beef stock pot (undiluted), 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp onion powder, 0.5 tsp dried thyme, 0.5 tsp mustard powder, 3 tbsp butter, 10 whole garlic cloves, 3 tbsp flour, 0.5 cup cooking cream, 0.5 cup parmesan.
Boil potatoes and mash with butter to taste.
Combine chicken stock, beef stock pot, onion powder, mustard powder and thyme in a bowl and set aside.
Combine flour and Parmesan cheese on a plate and set aside.
Slice chicken in half lengthways to create 2-3 thinner slices. Cover with cling film and pound to 0.5 inch thick. Pat completely dry.
Season each side with Italian seasoning and salt/pepper. Dredge in flour mixture and tap off excess.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium high heat. Sear the chicken in batches for 4-5 mins, until a golden crust has developed. Set aside.

Melt butter in the same pan over medium/medium low heat. Use a spatula to scrape the bottom of the pan, this will add more flavour to the sauce. Add the garlic cloves and let them soften and caramelize for 6-7 mins.
Add the flour and cook for 1-2 mins until the raw flour smell is gone.
Add the chicken stock mixture in spalshes, stirring constantly.
Stir in cooking cream. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Gradually stir in the Parmesan cheese.
Add the chicken back to the pan along with any juices on the plate. Spoon the sauce on top. Cover partially and simer for 5 mins.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Chicken Stew
method: Ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 chicken fillets (1 inch pieces), 3 tbsp flour, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp rosemary, 0.5 tsp salt, 6 garlic cloves (minced), 1 onion (diced), 3 carrots (peeled and sliced), 2 large potatoes (0.5 inch cubes), 3 cups chicken stock, 1 bay leaf, 0.5 cup milk, 1 cup peas.
Season chicken generously with salt and pepper.
Heat oil over medium high heat, add chicken and cook for 4-5 mins until browned on all sides. No need to cook through, just sear on outside as it will cook in slow cooker.
Once chicken is seared, place it in the slow cooker. Add flour, thyme, rosemary and salt and stir until chicke is well coated.
Add the garlic, onion, carrots and potatoes to the slow cooker and stir to combine. The pour in the stock and add the bay leaf.
Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Once cooked, add frozen peas and milk, stir to combine and cook for an additional 15 mins on high until the peas are warmed through.
Serve immediately, or store in the fridge for up to 5 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
method: Ingredients: 1 onion (chopped), 2 celery sticks (finely chopped), 2 tbsp rapeseed oil, 3 carrots (cut into chunks), 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 beef stock pots, potatoes (chunks), 900g beef (diced), 2 tsp cornstarch.
Cut potatoes into chunks and boil in salt water for mash.

Fry onion and celery in 1 tbsp oil over a low heat until they start to soften - about 5 mins. Add the carrots, bay leave and thyme, fry for 2 mins then stir in the tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce.
Add 600ml boiling water, stir and tip everything into a slow cooker. Add the beef stock pots and stir, then season with pepper. Don't add salt as the stock may be salty!
Clean out frying pan and fry beef in the remaining oil in batches until it is well browned, then tip each batch into the slow cooker.
Cook on low for 8-10 hours, or on high for 4 hours.

If you want to thicken the gravy, mix the cornstarch with a splash of cold water to make a paste then stir in 2 tbsp of the liquid from the slow cooker. Tip into slow cooker, stir and cook for a further 30 mins on high.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

meals.name: Mediterranean Lamb Stew
method: Ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 lb diced lamb, 2 tsp salt, -.25 tsp coarse black pepper, 1 cup onion (chopped), 6 garlic cloves (minced), 2 tsp cumin, 2 cans chopped tomatoes, 4 cups vegetable stock, 1/3 cup finely chopped mint, 1 cup finely chopped parsley.
In a pot over medium high heat, add olive oil, lamb, salt and pepper. Stir fry until the meat has browned and caramelized.
Next, lower the heat to medium. Add the onion and garlic. Saute until onions have softened.
Then, add cumin. Fry until aromatic, about 15 secs.
When ready, deglaze the pan with chopped tomatoes, smoked paprika and vegetable stock.
Mix in parsley and mint. Partially cover the pot with a lid. Bring to a boil.
Once a boil is reached, lower to a gentle simmer and continue to cook for 60 mins or until the lamb is fork tender.
Serve with boiled baby potatoes.

meals.name: BBQ Pulled Pork
method: Ingredients: 1 pork tenderloin, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 0.5 tsp garlic powder, 0.5 tsp onion powder, 1 cup chicken stock, 1 cup BBQ sauce.
Place tenderloin on a cutting board.
In a small bowl combine salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder and onion powder.
Rub the spice mixture all over the tenderloin then place it in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Add chicken stock to the bottom of the slow cooker (Don't pour it over the pork as it will wash off the spice rub. Pour it to the side, slowly.)
Add the lid and cook on high for 4-5 hours, or until the tenderloin is easy to shred with a fork.
Remove the pork from the crock pot, and shred with 2 forks. Return it to the slow cooker and mix it with any liquid that might have remained in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Add the BBQ sauce and stir to combine. Adjust salt and BBQ sauce amounts to your liking.
Serve with either chips, on crusty breadrolls, or both!

meals.name: Creamy Cubed Garlic Pork Bites
method: Ingredients: 4 boneless pork chops (1 inch cubed), 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp salt, 0.5 tsp black pepper, 1 tbsp olive oil, 0.25 cup butter, 1 tsp garlic (minced), 1 tbsp flour, 0.5 cup chicken stock, 0.5 cup cooking cream, 0.5 cup grated parmesan, 2 tbsp lemon juice, Potatoes (mashed).
Chop potatoes into chunks and boil in salted water to make mash.
Season pork evenly with onion powder, salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a oan over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add pork and sear for 3-5 mins on all sides until cooked through (about 13-15 mins total).
Remove pork from pan and set it on a plate. Cover with tinfoil to keep warm.
In the same pan, melt butter. Add garlic and cook for 1 min. Whisk in flour until slightly thickened.
Add in chicken stock, cooking cream, parmesan, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Let the sauce simmer for 5-8 mins, or until thickened.
Add pork cubes back to the pan and toss them in the sauce to coat.
Serve immediately with mashed potatoes.

meals.name: Rosemary Garlic Pork Chops
method: Ingredients: 4 pork chops, 0.25 cup flour, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp garlic powder, 0.5 tsp black pepper, 1 tbsp Olive oil, 2 tsp fresh rosemary (finley chopped), 2 garlic cloves (minced), 0.5 cup chicken stock, 6 tbsp butter, 1 lemon (wedged).
In a shallow dish, combine flour with salt, garlic powder and black pepper. One by one, coat both sides of the chops, then set aside.
Add 1 tbsp oil to a pan over medium high heat. Once hot, add the chops and fry each side for around 3 mins, or until golden on the outside and only just about cooked through the centre.
Place the chops on a plate and lower the heat to medium.

Add rosemary and garlic and fry in the leftover fat until the garlic just begins to take on colour. Pour in the stock, then whisk in butter until it melts and binds into a sauce. Simmer for 2-3 mins, stirring frequently, until the sauce turns cloudy and begins to thicken. Stir in the resting juices from the pork and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if desired.
Lower the heat and add the chops back in. Baste them in the sauce for just a minute, then serve immediately.

meals.name: Unbeatable Broccoli Pasta
method: Ingredients: Bacon fillet, Fusilli pasta, 1 head broccoli, juice from 1 lemon, 1 tub créme fraiche.
Cook fusilli per package instructions, set aside.
Chop bacon into chunks, then add to roasting tray along with broccoli florets. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with fresh ground black pepper. Roast until bacon is cooked through.
In a large bowl, mix cooked pasta and bacon/broccoli mixture together with 1 tub of créme fraiche.
Serve immediately.

meals.name: Philly Pasta
method: Cook penne; reserve pasta water.
Fry bacon, then cook mushrooms and peppers until softened.
Stir in cream cheese with a splash of pasta water to make a smooth sauce.
Toss through pasta and warm through.
Serve.

meals.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
method: Brown mince in a pan.
Add spaghetti sauce and simmer 10–15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti and drain.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.
Optional: add cheese.

meals.name: Roast Chicken and Mash
method: Roast whole chicken until cooked through; rest 10 minutes.
Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook mixed vegetables.
Carve chicken and serve with mash and veg.
Add gravy if desired.

meals.name: Steak and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook steak to your preference and rest 5 minutes.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve steak with mash, gravy, and veg.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Pork Chops and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook pork chops until done; rest briefly.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve together.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Lamb Chops and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Grill or pan-sear lamb chops; rest 5 minutes.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve together.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Burgers
method: Cook rashers until crisping; set aside.
Cook burger patties until done; add cheese to melt at the end.
Toast buns lightly.
Assemble burgers with rashers and cheese (add toppings as you like).
Serve hot.

meals.name: Fry Up
method: Cook sausages first as they take longest.
Add rashers to the pan and cook to your liking.
Cook mushrooms in the pan drippings (or a little butter).
Fry eggs last.
Toast bread and serve everything hot.

meals.name: Pizza
method: Heat oven as per package instructions.
Bake until crust is browned and cheese is bubbling.
Rest 2 minutes.
Slice and serve.
Optional: add sides/salad.

meals.name: Lasagne
method: Heat oven as per package instructions.
Bake until piping hot throughout and browned on top.
Rest 5–10 minutes before cutting.
Serve.
Optional: add salad/garlic bread.

meals.name: Chinese Pork Strips and Rice
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Toss pork strips with Chinese seasoning.
Stir-fry pork on high heat until cooked through.
Serve over rice.
Optional: add veg.

meals.name: Roast Ham and Veg
method: Roast ham fillet until hot through and cooked; rest 10 minutes.
Cook potatoes and mixed vegetables.
Heat gravy.
Slice ham and serve with veg and gravy.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Chicken Kievs and Chips
method: Bake chips and chicken kievs per package directions.
Ensure kievs are hot through.
Rest briefly and serve with chips.
Optional: add veg/salad.
Serve.

meals.name: Quiche and Chips
method: Bake chips per package directions.
Warm quiche in the oven until hot (or serve cold if preferred).
Serve together.
Optional: add salad/veg.
